meaningMnemonic:
You have the <kanji>same</kanji> <kanji>day</kanji>, which comes out to <vocabulary>same day</vocabulary>.

Note that this word is quite formal. To say <vocabulary>the same day</vocabulary> more casually, just use 同じ日!
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since 日 has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

On the <vocabulary>same day</vocabulary>, you once ate two entire <reading>dou</reading>ghnuts. <reading>Gee, two</reading> (どうじつ) on the same day? How did that feel?
